DescriptionText.Text: Some things (like a Garden) can't be built indoors.
We could put just about anything here as long as we put a tent over it.
We could set up some defenses here.
An empty socket
We depend on our radio to maintain contact with the brass, and with each other. We can also use it to reach out to other units stranded in the city.
Radio Highroad and request extraction on the next helo.
Upgrading to Sat-Comms will allow us to contact Highroad, our regimental HQ. Hopefully, someone will be there to pick up on the other end.
We need to upgrade our Radio Post if we want to reach Highroad.
Upgrading to Sat-Comms makes it easier to maintain more Outposts in the field. (Max Outposts raised to 8)
Upgrading to Sat-Comms will allow us to contact Highroad, our regimental HQ. Hopefully, someone will be there to pick up on the other end.

SummaryText.Text: Allows us to contact regimental HQ.

DescriptionText.Text: Allows us to contact regimental HQ.
Gives us access to intel and direction from HQ.
Used exclusively to monitor traffic and communicate with HQ. Recruiting is handled at the Ops Center. Supplies can be ordered from the Landing Zone.
We depend on our comms to maintain contact with the brass, and with each other. We can also use them to reach out to other units stranded in the city.
Radio Highroad and request extraction on the next helo.
Use our upgraded sat-comms to reach out to Highroad, our regimental HQ near the state capital, for new orders.
Our Sat-Comms allow us to maintain more Outposts in the field. (Max Outposts raised to 8)
This space used to be a restaurant. Fix it up, and we could use it as a mess for the soldiers.
This room is in disarray. We'll need to fix it up before we can use it.
There is a good kitchen here. Just need to clear out all the chaos and we can start using it as a mess.
Protects against Food Contamination.
Allows the preparation of feasts. (Need someone who really knows how to cook, though.)
The mess is where soldiers gather to eat terrible food and swap even worse stories about life down range.
Protects against Food Contamination.
Allows the preparation of feasts. (Need someone who really knows how to cook, though.)
The mess is where soldiers gather to eat terrible food and swap even worse stories about life down range.
Protects against Food Contamination.
Allows the preparation of feasts. (Need someone who really knows how to cook, though.)
Unfazed by the lack of a microwave.
Piece together a few new MREs from general food supplies.
It's almost food!
We made our own MREs! All it took was some plastic bags and bits of random food.
Brew some Army coffee, in case we run out of engine grease.
Fights fatigue and caffeine headaches. Also causes them.
Someone around here knows how to brew a mean cup of coffee.
Bake a delicious pie!
Sweet, warm, and full of love.
Nothing better than a homemade pie. Almost covers the smell of rotting death in the air.
+20 Max Vitality for everyone.
+20 Max Vitality and +10 Max Stamina for everyone.
Additional Vitality bonus for everyone.
+20 Max Vitality for everyone.
+20 Max Vitality for everyone.
Everybody's feeling a lot better after that dinner.
Additional Vitality and Stamina bonuses for everyone. (High likelihood of needing special ingredients.) REQUIRES GOOD COOK.
+20 Max Vitality and +10 Max Stamina for everyone.
+20 Max Vitality and +10 Max Stamina for everyone.
Just like Thanksgiving.
This is where we'll store the bulk of our supplies once we've cleared it out.
This room is in disarray. We'll need to fix it up before we can use it.
Clear out this space to use it as a Supply Room.
Increased space for resources like Food, Medicine, Ammo, Materials, and Fuel.
With a refrigerated storage area, we can really improve our ability to keep food fresh.
+40 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
This is where we store the basic Supplies that we rely on in the field.
+100 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Setting things up for safe food storage allows us to attempt sanitary food storage.
+10 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
Setting things up for safe food storage allows us to attempt sanitary food storage.
+30 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
Our supplies are packed tighter and smarter now. We can store a lot more now, and it lasts significantly longer ... though it can be hard to find what you need in a pinch.
+100 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
We should do some experiments with food preservation. Pickling, salting, smoking, canning. So many things to try. REQUIRES SOME EXPERIMENTATION.
Protects against spoilage and avoids food poisoning.
With a refrigerated storage area, we can really improve our ability to keep food fresh.
+10 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
Dramatically reduces food spoilage and food poisoning.
With a refrigerated storage area, we can really improve our ability to keep food fresh.
+40 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
Dramatically reduces food spoilage and food poisoning.
With a refrigerated storage area, we can really improve our ability to keep food fresh.
+100 Food, Ammo, Medicine, Fuel, and Materials capacity.
Protects against spoilage.
We should do some experiments with food preservation. Pickling, salting, smoking, canning. So many things to try. REQUIRES SOME EXPERIMENTATION.
Protects against spoilage and avoids food poisoning.
Dramatically reduces food spoilage and food poisoning.
The CO needs a designated space for research and planning.
This room is in disarray. We'll need to fix it up before we can use it.
Set up a space for the base's Commanding Officer, devoted to research and planning.
Our CO will provide benefits to the entire unit based on their individual leadership style.
The CO will also be able to issue orders that provide short-term advantages to the operation.
Research priorities are also set at the Ops Center, opening up advanced options at the other Facilities.
We could start gathering books and put together a reference area.
By sharing knowledge, we all improve our Wits faster.
+300% research speed. REQUIRES GOOD RESEARCHER.
This is the heart of the base, where the CO plans missions, makes strategic decisions, and researches new tactics.
A caring leader pays attention to their subordinates, and is constantly training them to be smarter, more observant soldiers. All soldiers gain Wits at twice the rate.
A compassionate leader.
A strict leader puts their subordinates through the paces, making sure every soldier makes the most of their nutrition and exercise. +10 stamina to every soldier.
A strict leader.
A practical leader is always exploring new options and is ready with a backup plan in any disaster. Bonus to research rates.
An organized leader.
The Commanding Officer determines which set of tactics and bonuses are available here. Currently, this unit is functioning without a Commanding Officer.
While this order is active, soldiers will constantly scavenge for small amounts of supplies in the surrounding area.
While this order is active, soldiers will constantly scavenge for small amounts of supplies in the surrounding area.
While this order is active, soldiers will hunt zombies around the perimeter to keep the Threat Level low, and make attacks less frequent.

ErrorText.Text: Need a Strict or Organized Leader.

DescriptionText.Text: While this order is active, soldiers will hunt zombies around the perimeter to keep the Threat Level low, and make attacks less frequent.
While this order is active, our unit will search the city for surviving soldiers to add to our ranks.

ErrorText.Text: Need a Compassionate or Organized Leader.

DescriptionText.Text: While this order is active, our unit will search the city for surviving soldiers to add to our ranks.
We need to build up the expertise it will take to replace our gas generator with a solar array.
The solar array collects energy during the day, and outputs from batteries during the night. There is no need for fuel.
We now have the expertise to install cutting-edge solar collectors and backup batteries in place of our old gas generator.
Unlocks the ability to create Box Mines. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.
So what if it's a bunch of nuts and bolts in an old paint can? It still explodes.
So what if it's a bunch of nuts and bolts in an old paint can? It still explodes.
Unlocks the ability to create Whistling Box Mines. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.
Cram a noisemaker into an improvised mine, and it lures the zombies in before it explodes. Nice.
Cram a noisemaker into an improvised mine, and it lures the zombies in before it explodes. Nice.

SummaryText.Text: Whistling Box Mines available for construction.

DescriptionText.Text: Unlocks the ability to create Pipe Bombs. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.
It's a bunch of explosives stuffed into a pipe. What could go wrong?
Unlocks the ability to create Pipe Bombs. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.
Unlocks the ability to create Steel Pipe Bombs. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.
It's a WHOLE bunch of explosives stuffed into a pipe. Extra shrapnel means more dead zombies.
Unlocks the ability to create Steel Pipe Bombs. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB.

SummaryText.Text: Steel Pipe Bombs available for construction.

DescriptionText.Text: Unlocks the ability to create Chemical Incendiaries. REQUIRES A WEAPONS LAB and MEDICAL LAB.
Sets zeds on fire. They don't seem to like it much. Watch it with this one--it's got a kick.
Sets zeds on fire. They don't seem to like it much. Watch it with this one--it's got a kick.
Would allow us to create more effective stimulants (Uses up medical supplies.) REQUIRES MEDICAL LAB.
Restores max Stamina a lot. Fresh from our lab, cooked up extra potent. (Addictive?)
Restores max Stamina a lot. Fresh from our lab, cooked up extra potent. (Addictive?)

SummaryText.Text: Potent Homemade Stims available for construction.

DescriptionText.Text: Our only gateway to the outside world.
This area is in disarray. We'll need to fix it up before we can use it.
Set up a proper Landing Zone, so we can call in supplies and equipment from the outside.
Our LZ is highly visible from the air, and makes a great drop zone for supplies from HQ.
Our LZ is highly visible from the air, and makes a great drop zone for supplies from HQ.

SummaryText.Text: Our only gateway to the outside world.

DescriptionText.Text: Our only gateway to the outside world.
A simple survival package. Just enough to keep us going.
Food, medicine, ammunition, materials, and fuel.
We've received a package of general supplies to get us through the next little while.

SummaryText.Text: We've received a small delivery of supplies.

DescriptionText.Text: A package of military construction materials, with a few other supplies to keep our base strong.
Materials, tools, and fuel.
We've received a package of building materials, fuel, and tools to help us shore up our position.
A package of lifesaving supplies, including food and medicine.
Lifesaving food and medical supplies to keep us going until the mission is complete.
We've received a package of food and medical supplies. Hopefully, it will keep us alive long enough to complete this operation.
A well-stocked supply drop of army-issue munitions.
Army-issue ammunition, grenades, and mines. Includes 9mm, 5.56mm, 7.62mm, .50 BMG, and Shotgun rounds.
We've received a generous package of Army-issue ammunition and explosive ordnance.
A supply drop containing two random weapons, extra mags, and some suppressors.
Military-grade hardware that you can only get through special channels.
We've received a package of high-end weapons, plus a few extra mags and some suppressors.
A major supply drop called in from a more distant location. Requires sat-comms and a boosted signal.
Food, medicine, ammunition, materials, and fuel.
Military-grade hardware that you can only get through special channels.
Things must be better on the other side of the country. We've got more resources and equipment now than we know what to do with.
A simple survival package. Just enough to keep us going.
Food, medicine, ammunition, materials, and fuel.
We've received a package of general supplies to get us through the next little while.

Our LZ is highly visible from the air, and makes a great drop zone for supplies from HQ.
A place to make the things we don't have, and maintain the things we do.
A workshop will let us build the stuff that we can't requisition, and maintain the stuff that we can.
Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)
We could make the things we need to fight zombies instead of having to scavenge for everything.
Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
Automatically repair stored weapons each day ... or do it manually at the Supply Locker for 15 Influence.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)
A full-fledged workshop would give us the ability to repair cars.
Allows you to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)
Create basic equipment like suppressors, distractions, and molotov cocktails, to supplement our loadout.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.

SummaryText.Text: Good for making and repairing stuff.

DescriptionText.Text: Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
Free up this space for something else.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
Automatically repair stored weapons each day ... or do it manually at the Supply Locker for 15 Influence.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)
Automatically repair Body and Tire damage for vehicles parked overnight.
Creates a couple of improvised suppressors.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Decent construction; this one should last 30 shots, give or take.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Decent construction; this one should last 30 shots, give or take.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Decent construction; this one should last 30 shots, give or take.
Creates a few improvised firecrackers.
Sudden noises are great for grabbing attention. (Best to toss these and then run or hide.)

Creates a few improvised firetraps.
Like a Molotov, but this one's pressure sensitive.

Like a Molotov, but this one's pressure sensitive.
A dedicated ammunition shop will let us refill our brass, and manufacture the ammunition we need from the random stuff we scavenge in the field.
Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)
Collect your brass, and you can manufacture ammunition in the calibers you need, not just the ones you happen to find.
Automatically repair body, engine, and tire damage. Replace lost bumpers and doors.

SummaryText.Text: Good for building, repairing, and reloading our weapons.

DescriptionText.Text: Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
A workshop focused on making explosives and incendiaries.
Allows us to repair and unjam weapons at the Supply Locker.
Build everything faster with electric power tools. (+100% Construction Speed)

With the right expertise, we can really up our game with improvised weapons and distractions.

SummaryText.Text: Good for repairs, and for building advanced improvised weapons.

+100% construction rate. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.

Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .22-caliber ammunition.
Small caliber rounds for pistols, revolvers, rifles, and SMGs.
We've got some more rounds of .22 ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of 9mm ammunition.
Small caliber rounds for pistols, revolvers and rifles.
We've got some more rounds of 9mm ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .357-caliber ammunition.
Powerful round for revolvers and some rifles.
We've got some more rounds of .357 ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .40-caliber ammunition.
Mid-range round for pistols and some submachineguns.
We've got some more rounds of .40 ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .44-caliber ammunition.
Powerful round primarily for revolvers and some rifles.
We've got some more rounds of .44 ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .45-caliber ammunition.
Powerful mid-range workhorse for pistols, some revolvers and rifles.
We've got some more rounds of .45 ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of 5.56mm ammunition.
Standard NATO battle rifle caliber, includes the .223 caliber family of rounds as well.
We've got some more rounds of 5.56mm ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of 7.62mm ammunition.
Powerful round used the world over, includes the entirety of the thirty caliber family of rifle ammunition. Used by battle rifles and long range rifles.
We've got some more rounds of 7.62mm ammunition.
Refills some brass to generate several magazines' worth of .50 BMG ammunition.
Very powerful round for large frame revolvers, pistols and long range rifles.
We've got some more rounds of .50 BMG ammunition.
Refills some shells to generate several boxes' worth of shotgun ammunition.
For shotguns.
We've got some more shotgun shells.
Uses some insane chemistry to generate a box of incendiary shotgun ammunition. For Incendiary Shotguns ONLY.
For specialized INCENDIARY SHOTGUNS ONLY. Don't go tearing up the barrels of our regular shotguns.
Great. Some idiot decided to make their own homebrew incendiary rounds. Now I have to worry about soldiers spontaneously setting themselves on fire.
Refills some cartridges to generate a handful of 40mm grenades for grenade launchers.
For grenade launchers. Obviously.
We've got some more rounds of 40mm grenade ammunition.
Free up this space for something else.
Where the medics can do their work.
We need a clean place where our medics can do their work.
+10 Max Vitality for everyone. 15% Recovery Chance from injury/illness each day.
Improves Vitality. Increases the chance of Recovery from injuries and illness each day.
+10 Max Vitality for everyone. 15% Recovery Chance from injury/illness each day.
An area set aside for our medics, who can help soldiers recover from injuries and illness.

+20% Recovery Chance. REQUIRES TRAINED HEALER.

SummaryText.Text: Now we can cook up some things.

Allows manufacture of painkillers and stimulants.
+20% Recovery Chance. REQUIRES TRAINED HEALER.
A properly-equipped surgery facility will allow us to treat serious injuries while away from base. REQUIRES TRAINED HEALER.
+10 Max Vitality for everyone. 30% Recovery Chance from injury/illness each day.
We'll have the necessary tools, and the necessary hygiene, to perform more serious medical procedures.
+20% Recovery Chance. REQUIRES TRAINED HEALER.
When soldiers come back from the battlefield, sometimes they have injuries that a few painkillers won't fix. The Surgery allows us to fix them up properly.

SummaryText.Text: Finally, a sanitary place to cut people.

Study regimen assigned!
Free up this space for something else.
This room is in disarray. We'll need to fix it up before we can use it.
This room would make a good barracks if we could clean out all this crap.
Provides bunks for 8 additional soldiers.
Increases everyone's stamina by 10. (MUST HAVE A BED FOR EVERYONE.)
The more people we have, the more beds we need. This'll give us a few more places to sleep.

SummaryText.Text: Nothing beats a good night's rest.

DescriptionText.Text: Provides bunks for 8 additional soldiers.
Increases everyone's stamina by 10. (MUST HAVE A BED FOR EVERYONE.)
A typical Army field barracks, rich with that memorable FAN aroma.
Provides bunks for 64 additional soldiers.
Increases everyone's stamina by 10. (MUST HAVE A BED FOR EVERYONE.)
Decent lighting in the barracks allows soldiers to study up and be more prepared to survive the next day. (Gain Wits faster)
Decent lighting in the barracks allows soldiers to study up and be more prepared to survive the next day. (Gain Wits faster)
Study regimen assigned!
Digging a latrine will make a huge difference to our sanitation problem.
Digging a latrine sounds like a shit job, but everyone will thank me later.
Keep it clean to protect against sickness.
An army marches on its stomach ... and if you don't dig a proper latrine, they'll be marching in something else soon afterwards.

SummaryText.Text: Got tired of wading in other people's shit.

DescriptionText.Text: Keep it clean to protect against sickness.
Clean facilities for the disposal of human waste.
It's a dirty job, but somebody's got to do it. A clean latrine is the key to a healthy unit.

SummaryText.Text: Someone is going to have to muck it out.

DescriptionText.Text: A sanitary latrine is the key to a healthy base.
Free up this space for something else.
This latrine is a toxic disaster area. Send someone in with a hazmat suit ASAP.
Someone has to do the thankless job of mucking out the latrine. Otherwise, we all risk getting seriously ill.
One more soldier now has the thousand-yard stare of a veteran. A veteran of latrine-cleaning duty.

SummaryText.Text: I have seen things that you cannot possibly imagine.

DescriptionText.Text: A sanitary latrine is the key to a healthy base. Or so they tell us. We wouldn't know from experience.
Free up this space for something else.
To provide Electricity.
Uses up Fuel to provide electricity to the base. (Some facilities and actions require electricity.) REQUIRES WORKSHOP.
Uses fuel to provide electricity.
Uses up Fuel to provide electricity to the base. (Some facilities and actions require electricity.) REQUIRES WORKSHOP.
Uses fuel to provide electricity.
A common gas generator, salvaged from a civilian shop. It burns through fuel like a mofo, but it keeps the equipment running.
Fuel it up and flip the switch for thirty minutes of electric power.
While the power is on, we can cook hot meals and run our more advanced facilities.
Replace this gas guzzler with a modern solar array with battery backup.
Everything in the base runs continuously without fuel. Battery backup provides power at night.
Our new solar array will collect energy during the day, and output from batteries at night. No more fuel runs to fill the generator.
Free up this space for something else.
Uses fuel to provide electricity.
Collects energy from the sun during the day, and charges batteries to use at night.
The solar array collects energy during the day, and outputs from batteries during the night. There is no need for fuel.
Free up this space for something else.
Repairs all damaged components of the vehicle. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
Replaces the vehicle's tires.
Replaces the vehicle's doors.
Repairs the vehicle's body.
Repairs the vehicle's engine. REQUIRES TOOLS EXPERT.
Space for one vehicle. Find this location outside the base, and park there to gain its benefits.
We can hold the zeds off more effectively if we lay traps in the area outside the base.
Replenish the Mines, Propane Tanks, and Fireworks at the same time.
Lay IFF mines that will blow up the zombies, but deactivate in the presence of friendlies.
Arrange fireworks outside the perimeter as a potential distraction.
Place propane tanks just outside the gates for one-shot zombie dispersal.
Placing explosive ordnance around the perimeter allows us to dramatically thin each oncoming horde before engaging them in CQB.
To help defend our home.
Something to protect our perimeter. Having a watchtower increases the safe area around our home.
Having someone up here should help keep the zeds at bay.
We've been actively sniping zombies, giving us a larger safe area around our home.
Something to protect our perimeter. Having a watchtower increases the safe area around our home.
Having someone up here should help keep the zeds at bay.
We've been actively sniping zombies, giving us a larger safe area around our home.
Having someone up here should help keep the zeds at bay.
Keeping an eye out for trouble.
We've been actively sniping zombies, giving us a larger safe area around our home.
We can extend the safe area around our home with a little sharpshooting.
We could make something a little less rickety. REQUIRES WORKSHOP.
Having someone up here should help keep the zeds at bay.
We've been actively sniping zombies, giving us a larger safe area around our home.
Raises shooting skill for the whole community.
Something to protect our perimeter. Having a watchtower increases the safe area around our home.

Provides additional resources each day... until the supply runs out.
A place to resupply without traveling all the way home.
Increase protected range around the outpost.
Surrender this location to the zeds.
This should help us spot incoming hordes. We might even be able to take out a few of them before they get to our base.
